noun.description: A prolonged and bitter quarrel or dispute.
examples: one of the most volatile feuds that currently rock the scientific community

verb.description: Take part in a prolonged quarrel or conflict.
examples: Hoover feuded with the CIA for decades
these two families have been feuding since the Civil War

origin: Middle English fede hostility, ill will, from Old French feide, from Middle Dutch, Middle Low German vēde, of Germanic origin; related to foe.
